We're proud to host Jade and Nia as part of this year's outstanding cohort of SCORE students!

The Summer Program for Undergraduate Research (SCORE) brings talented undergraduates from diverse backgrounds to conduct cutting-edge research at the University of Oregon. Jade and Nia (second and third from left in photo) exemplify the excellence and enthusiasm that SCORE students bring to our research community.

## About SCORE

The SCORE program:
- Provides intensive research experiences
- Supports students from underrepresented backgrounds
- Offers professional development opportunities
- Builds pathways to graduate education
- Strengthens diversity in STEM fields

## Research Excellence

Jade and Nia are conducting research on:
- Population genomics of adaptation
- Laboratory techniques in molecular biology
- Bioinformatic analysis pipelines
- Scientific communication skills
- Collaborative research practices

## Jade's Project

Jade is investigating:
- Genomic variation in natural populations
- Environmental drivers of adaptation
- Data analysis using R and Python
- Integration of field and laboratory approaches
- Presentation of scientific findings

## Nia's Research

Nia is exploring:
- Host-microbiome interactions
- Molecular techniques for microbiome analysis
- Developmental biology approaches
- Statistical analysis of complex datasets
- Science communication strategies

## Program Impact

SCORE provides students with:
- Hands-on research experience
- Mentorship from graduate students and faculty
- GRE preparation and graduate school guidance
- Conference presentation opportunities
- Peer support and community

## Lab Mentorship

Our lab supports SCORE students through:
- One-on-one mentoring relationships
- Integration into research teams
- Professional development activities
- Conference presentation preparation
- Graduate school application assistance

## Building Community

The SCORE cohort creates:
- Peer support networks
- Collaborative learning environments
- Lasting professional relationships
- Diverse perspectives in science
- Inclusive research communities

## Success Stories

Previous SCORE students from our lab have:
- Entered top graduate programs
- Published research findings
- Presented at national conferences
- Pursued careers in science
- Become science advocates

## Diversity in Science

Programs like SCORE are essential for:
- Increasing representation in STEM
- Bringing diverse perspectives to research
- Addressing disparities in science careers
- Building inclusive scientific communities
- Advancing scientific innovation

We're grateful for the energy, perspectives, and contributions that Jade, Nia, and all SCORE students bring to our research community!
